result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Tyler J. Brandenburg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where he believes such contraband as defined in Chapter 961 may be present.
Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.  Long guns during hunting season allowed.
Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with Darlene Oxford, Trevor Bennett, Kenneth Schneider, Synjin Jenks or Shawen Jones.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.
Credit for 63 days, if probation is revoked.

ADA Fassbender present.
Def. present - in custody.
ADA Fassbender requests cash bond be amended to $10,000 co-signature by his mother, Sherri Brandenburg.
Court directs $10,000 co-signature bond with the following conditions:
No contact (directly or indirectly) with Darlene Oxford, Trevor Bennett, Kenneth Schneider, Synjin Jenks or Shawen Jones.
Def. to not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Def. to possess prescription medications only with a valid prescription and take in manner and method as prescribed.
Def. to obtain prescriptions from only 1 pharmacy and shall report to Waupaca County Jail any prescription changes within 72 hours.
Def. to not possess any firearms or dangerous weapons.
Def. to enter and complete the 28 day Nova Treatment program.
Def. to not leave the premises of the Nova Treatment facility until completion of program.
Once def. has completed the Nova Treatment program, he is to follow all after care recommendations and be in compliance with the counselor recommendations.
Def. to reside in the home of his mother, Sherri Brandenburg, after he completes the Nova program.
